title: Shakespeare - kopie 1 - kopie 1
description:
The English Renaissance was a very interesting period and Shakespeare was a product of his time, his background and his opportunities. Without these, his plays would have not been written the way they were.
In this webquest we will find out a lot about the backgrounds, history and customs of these times.
Shakespeare has been very important for the English language, he invented many new words and we are still using them.

items.content:
• Onderwerp
    Shakespeare
  • Schooltype
    VO (havo/vwo)
  • Doelgroep
    Klas 5 & 6
  • Vakgebieden
    Engels
  • Aantal personen
    4 leerlingen
  • Totale tijd
    3 tot 5 klokuren

In this webquest we will go back to the Elizabethan Age, The English Renaissance, the time in which William Shakespeare wrote his masterworks like Macbeth, Hamlet, Romeo and Juliet and many others. Who was this Shakespeare, why did he become so famous, what did the theatres look like? You will also do some research for Romeo and Juliet. Shakespeare may be dead for four hundred years but the themes he used are universal and very much alive, they are still existing and relevant in our modern times and lives.

?

INTRODUCTION

The English Renaissance was a very interesting period and Shakespeare was a product of his time, his background and his opportunities. Without these, his plays would have not been written the way they were.

In this webquest we will find out a lot about the backgrounds, history and customs of these times.

Shakespeare has been very important for the English language, he invented many new words and we are still using them.

Listen to one of his most famous sonnets, sonnet number 18.

?

TASK

After doing this webquest each group has to give an oral presentation ( 10 min.) on Shakespeare's life, his works, his times, the theatres and some research for Romeo and Juliet. This presentation can include posters, pictures, use of the blackboard/ beamer, costumes, whatever you like.

In the 'bronnen' you will find some links to some video fragments. Be sure to watch these, they are funny and give you a lot of information.

Do the Shakespeare biography quiz. (see 'bronnen')?

PROCESS

Step 1

You will work together in groups of four. Find three other students you´d like to work with.

Step 2

Each of you is going to do different things.

Number 1 becomes a specialist of Shakespeare's life and work. Make a short list of his most famous works.

Number 2 will go back to The Renaissance and the Elizabethan age. How was Shakespeare influenced by his time, how did it influence his work.

Number 3 is going to find out about the Theatres, actors, costumes and the customs of these days.

Number 4 will introduce us to one of Shakespeare's most famous plays, Romeo and Juliet. When did he write it, when was it first performed etc.

?

You can find all the information you need in the ´bronnen´. You can also use resources you have found yourself, that is up to you. Read all the information thoroughly, gather all the information you need and put it together on a big poster.

Time: 90 minutes.

Step 3

After you have completed this, it is time to prepare your oral presentation. Each of you has to give a (rather fluent) speech on your own topic of about 2 or 3 minutes. So it is very important to prepare it well and to practice a few times.

You are allowed to write down your speech on a piece of paper if that makes you feel more secure.

Time: 45 minutes

Step 4

Now it is time to give your presentation. Use your poster and whatever you think is useful to give a fluent presentation. Each group has got about 10 minutes.

Time: 60 minutes (depends on the number of groups)

Step 5

The teacher and students will evaluate each speech according to given criteria. You will have to listen carefully to each presentation in order to give a fair evaluation. Evaluation forms will be provided by your teacher.

?

RESOURCES

You can use the following resources:

http://www.online-literature.com/shakespeare/

http://shakespeare.palomar.edu

Here you can find everything about Shakespeare's life and works, Shakespeare genealogy, a Shakespeare timeline summary chart. If you click on 'works' you will get his works. At the left you will see all the topics.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eBRfj5ahlNc&feature=related

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j2vLiv07svY&feature=related

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ec_pDV07pQg&feature=related

Watch these video fragments, they are very informative.

http://shakespeare.palomar.edu/quiz/bioquiz.htm

Do this quiz and you will not forget anything, or add the quiz to your presentation.

http://www.geocities.com/trichard_ca/Globe.html

Here you can find a lot about the theatres.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1mtzbR2eKDU&feature=related

Watch this video fragment about the theatres

http://absoluteshakespeare.com/

http://www.springfield.k12.il.us/schools/springfield/eliz/elizabethanengland.html

Everything about Shakespeare, Elizabethan England, Theatres.

http://www.shakespeare.org.uk

Here you can find some things about Shakespeare's birthplace etc

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Romeo_and_Juliet

http://dewey.library.upenn.edu/sceti/furness/eric/teach/RJ/rj_trailer3.html

Everything about Romeo and Juliet.

http://www.gvanwingerde.nl/nieuw/articles.php?lng=nl&pg=362

A nice scetch about Shakespeare

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N-0FsTVY3Cs&feature=PlayList&p=E96D101C6220EF05&index=0&playnext=1

The reduced Shakespeare company, very funny to watch. Watch at least for 10 minutes.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JBfItJAFUQU

Watch this videofragment, a Song for us from Romeo and Juliet.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9H2htG2bv20&feature=related

Living Iambic pentameter - you will have to do this too!

?

EVALUATION FORM

The teacher and your classmates will evaluate your presentation according to the following criteria:

inadequate adequate good score

2 4 6

1. content / originality ..... ..... ..... .....

2. pronunciation / fluency ..... ..... ..... .....

3. accuracy (grammar, vocab) ..... ..... ..... .....

4. structure / organisation ..... ..... ..... ......

5. body language ..... ..... ..... ......

?

CONCLUSION

At the end of this webquest you will have learnt:

  1. to use a search engine to find specific information on the web
  2. to read authentic texts
  3. to listen to authentic videofragments
  4. a lot about Shakespeare´s life and work
  5. a lot about the Renaissance and the Elizabethan Age
  6. a lot about the theatres, actors, costumes and customs of these times
  7. the beginnings of Romeo and Juliet
  8. how Shakespeare and his works were influenced by his times
  9. new words related to the topic of literature
  10. to select and summarise the most relevant information on the topic
  11. to elaborate the material found on the Internet and create an interesting poster
  12. to prepare an oral speech and present it convincingly to the class
  13. to listen to a presentation
  14. to evaluate your classmates´work according to given criteria
  15. to work in small teams in order to achieve the given tasks

?

Taal van de website: Engels Trefwoorden: Shakespeare´s life, Shakespeare´s works, Renaissance, Elizabethan Age, Romeo an Juliet Opbrengst van de webquest: Knowledge about Shakespeare´s life, works and times. Extra benodigde materialen: A sheet of paper and glue. Webquestmakers: Sonja Rijkse

Deze WebQuest is goed te gebruiken bij:

Methode: No method. Hoofdstuk / Les: It is part of a lesson series about Shakespeare and Romeo and Juliet.
TEACHER'S PAGE
Foreword
I have designed this webquest to introduce students to Shakespeare´s life, his work and his times. I think it is much more interesting and stimulating by means of this webquest. I hope they will get motivated for literature and that it will increase their pleasure for reading literature.
Level
This webquest has been designed for class 4 / 5 vwo students, level B1/2.
Length
This webquest will take about three hours, but it depends of course on the pupils' ability to surf on the Internet, their level of understanding and on the number of groups.
Aims

At the end of this webquest your students will have learnt:

  1. to use a search engine to find specific information on the web
  2. to read authentic texts
  3. to listen to authentic videofragments
  4. a lot about Shakespeare´s life and work
  5. a lot about the Renaissance and the Elizabethan Age
  6. a lot about the theatres, actors, costumes and customs of these times
  7. the beginnings of Romeo and Juliet
  8. how Shakespeare and his works were influenced by his times
  9. new words related to the topic of literature
  10. to select and summarise the most relevant information on the topic
  11. to elaborate the material found on the Internet and create an interesting poster
  12. to prepare an oral speech and present it convincingly to the class
  13. to listen to a presentation
  14. to evaluate their classmates´work according to a given standard
  15. to work in small teams in order to achieve the given tasks
Tips
Be sure your pupils are all able to use the Internet properly.
Students need some big sheets of paper and glue to create their posters.
It could be a good idea to organise the oral presentations as a competition.
References
The pictures and videofragments have been taken from the Internet (see ' bronnen' ).
This webquest has been designed as part of a lesson series project on Shakespeare and Romeo and Juliet.
